calibration¶

Created on Wed Feb 13 15:37:43 2019
@author: Semeon Risom
@email: semeon.risom@gmail.com.
Sample code to run SR Research Eyelink eyetracking system. Code is optimized for the Eyelink 1000 Plus (5.0),
but should be compatiable with earlier systems.
class calibration.calibration(w, h, tracker, window)[source]¶

Bases: pylink.tracker.EyeLinkCustomDisplay

This inherits a default class from pylink then adds psychopy stim.

Methods

alert_printf(msg) Print error messages.
clear_cal_display() Clear the calibration display.

setup_drift_display() Sets up the initial drift display
setup_image_display(width, height) Set up the camera image, for newer APIs, the size is 384 x 320 pixels.

set_image_palette(r, g, b)[source]¶

Given a set of RGB colors, create a list of 24bit numbers representing the pallet. Example: RGB of (1,64,127) would be saved as 82047, or the number 00000001 01000000 011111111.
